objtitle.title: Receipt by Thomas Butts signed by Blake, 9 September 1806

objinfo.numberleaves: 1The receipt was written on one side of a single sheet in a very elegant, official hand, while the signature is distinctly Blake's. To the left of the text is an embossed revenue stamp depicting a shield bearing the union flag and surrounded by the motto “DIEU ET MON DROIT”. Above the shield is a coronet and on the left and right sides are sprigs of long, narrow leaves. Below the shield is the phrase “TWO PENCE / FOR RECEIPT”.

provenance.name: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery
provenance.note: From the Butts collection. Separated at some unknown date from the other similar receipts in this collection and known to have been in the posession of Ruthven Todd from 1942. Sold in April 1998 by Marvin Sadik Fine Arts, Catalogue 1, to John Windle and by him to the Huntington Library in May 1998 with funds provided by Robert Essick.
